verses.text: Every wise woman buildeth her house: But the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the \sc Lord\sc*: But he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
In the mouth of the foolish \add is\add* a rod of pride: But the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
Where no oxen \add are\add*, the crib \add is\add* clean: But much increase \add is\add* by the strength of the ox.
A faithful witness will not lie: But a false witness will utter lies.
A scorner seeketh wisdom, and \add findeth it\add* not: But knowledge \add is\add* easy unto him that understandeth.
Go from the presence of a foolish man, When thou perceivest not \add in him\add* the lips of knowledge.
The wisdom of the prudent \add is\add* to understand his way: But the folly of fools \add is\add* deceit.
Fools make a mock at sin: But among the righteous \add there is\add* favour.
The heart knoweth his own bitterness; And a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: But the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, But the end thereof \add are\add* the ways of death.
Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; And the end of that mirth \add is\add* heaviness.
The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: And a good man \add shall be satisfied\add* from himself.
The simple believeth every word: But the prudent \add man\add* looketh well to his going.
A wise \add man\add* feareth, and departeth from evil: But the fool rageth, and \add is\add* confident.
\add He that is\add* soon angry dealeth foolishly: And a man of wicked devices is hated.
The simple inherit folly: But the prudent are crowned \add with\add* knowledge.
The evil bow before the good; And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: But the rich \add hath\add* many friends.
He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: But he that hath mercy on the poor, happy \add is\add* he.
Do they not err that devise evil? But mercy and truth \add shall be to\add* them that devise good.
In all labour there is profit: But the talk of the lips \add tendeth\add* only to penury.
The crown of the wise \add is\add* their riches: \add But\add* the foolishness of fools \add is\add* folly.
A true witness delivereth souls: But a deceitful \add witness\add* speaketh lies.
In the fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* strong confidence: And his children shall have a place of refuge.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* a fountain of life, To depart from the snares of death.
In the multitude of people \add is\add* the king’s honour: But in the want of people \add is\add* the destruction of the prince.
\add He that is\add* slow to wrath \add is\add* of great understanding: But \add he that is\add* hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
A sound heart \add is\add* the life of the flesh: But envy the rottenness of the bones.
He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: But he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: But the righteous hath hope in his death.
Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: But \add that which is\add* in the midst of fools is made known.
Righteousness exalteth a nation: But sin \add is\add* a reproach to any people.
The king’s favour \add is\add* toward a wise servant: But his wrath is \add against\add* him that causeth shame.
